hanzi-su-wiki:
歩

Значения

Идти, ходить; шаг; мера площади — 3,3 кв.м; счётный суффикс для шагов

Мнемоника

Нога 止 и её отпечаток.

Варианты

步

старый вариант шага

渉 頻
heisig_story: Footprints that follow one another a few at a time indicate walking.
koohiiStory1: When walking your pet, you must stop a few times along the way when nature calls.
koohiiStory2: When you learn to walk, you take your steps a few at a time. Picture a clumsy but happy toddler who falls every few steps but keeps getting up to try again.
jp_example_words:
歩み(あゆみ): walking
歩む(あゆむ): to walk, to go on foot
譲歩(じょうほ): concession, conciliation, compromise
徒歩(とほ): walking, going on foot
歩(ふ): pawn (in chess or shogi)
進歩(しんぽ): progress, development
歩道(ほどう): footpath, walkway, sidewalk
歩く(あるく): to walk
散歩(さんぽ): walk, stroll
jp_readingExamples: 歩道 (ほどう), 徒歩 (とほ), 進歩 (しんぽ), 歩合 (ぶあい), 日歩 (ひぶ), 歩む (あゆ.む), 歩く (ある.く)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You stop at a small slide. What were you doing before you stopped here? You were walking.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Question is, what made you stop? Imagine yourself walking at a nice casual pace... then imagine something that would make you stop that's incredibly interesting and strange. Maybe an alien is going down the slide? He would say "keep walking, friend."
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: So, you're walking around, minding your own business, when suddenly something flips up and whacks you in the face. You stepped on the head of a hoe (ほ) and it caused it to swing up from the ground and hit you.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Of course, imagine the pain of your face. Did your nose break? After bringing yourself together, look down at what hit you. It's a hoe! How did you manage to step on just the right spot to flip it up on you like that? Examine the hoe. Pay close attention to it. Whose hoe is this? etc.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: take few (少) stops (止) when you walk

Name meaning

bù
яп. вм. 步
Radicals: 止, 小, 丿  (stop, small, slide)
Meaning Mnemonic
You stop at a small slide. What were you doing before you stopped here? You were walking.
Question is, what made you stop? Imagine yourself walking at a nice casual pace... then imagine something that would make you stop that's incredibly interesting and strange. Maybe an alien is going down the slide? He would say "keep walking, friend."
Reading Mnemonic
So, you're walking around, minding your own business, when suddenly something flips up and whacks you in the face. You stepped on the head of a hoe (ほ) and it caused it to swing up from the ground and hit you.
Of course, imagine the pain of your face. Did your nose break? After bringing yourself together, look down at what hit you. It's a hoe! How did you manage to step on just the right spot to flip it up on you like that? Examine the hoe. Pay close attention to it. Whose hoe is this? etc.

ノ, 小 (маленький), 止 (останавливать)
